# magma.gsi

*MAGMA* is a slowing moving but powerful model that combine mark and age
information with genetic mixture analysis. Mainly, *MAGMA* estimates two
sets of parameters: stock and age. A composition of the two, information
that is often required for run reconstruction models, is simply the
product of these two sets of parameters. After all age/stock
compositions in other strata are calculated in the same fashion, they
are multiplied by the harvest proportions of their corresponding strata
and summed up to get a weighted average age/stock composition.

## Installation

You can install the development version of *magma.gsi* from
[GitHub](https://github.com/boppingshoe/magma.gsi) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("boppingshoe/magma.gsi", build_vignettes = TRUE)
```

## Example

Once you have the data sets up at a designated directory, you can
compile the input object:

``` r
library(magma.gsi)

wd <- getwd() # path to data folder
magma_data <- magmatize_data(wd = paste0(wd, "/vignettes"), save_data = FALSE)
#> Compiling input data, may take a minute or two...
#> FAKE is the fishery identified in the mixture.RData
#> No missing hatcheries
#> Time difference of 5.489551 secs
```

Run the model:

``` r
magma_out <- magmatize_mdl(magma_data, nreps = 50, nburn = 25, thin = 1, nchains = 3)
#> Running model... and work for a cause, not for Face!
#> Time difference of 1.383024 secs
#> 2026-01-09 13:08:59.182547
```

Summarize the results:

``` r
magma_summ <- magmatize_summ(ma_out = magma_out, ma_dat = magma_data, summ_level = "district")
#> Preparing output (patience grasshopper...)
#> Time difference of 0.489537 secs
#> 2026-01-09 13:08:59.687217

magma_summ$age_summ[1]
#> $D1_Koyukuk
#> # A tibble: 9 × 10
#>   group   age     mean  median     sd      ci.05  ci.95     p0    GR n_eff
#>   <chr>   <fct>  <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>      <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 Koyukuk 11    0.0211 0.00420 0.0379 0.00000723 0.0932 0.133   1.02  75  
#> 2 Koyukuk 12    0.0222 0.00572 0.0428 0.00000322 0.0856 0.187   1.06  75  
#> 3 Koyukuk 13    0.0194 0.00819 0.0300 0.0000325  0.0733 0.0933  1.02  75  
#> 4 Koyukuk 21    0.0219 0.00523 0.0364 0.0000492  0.0958 0.12    1.11  63.3
#> 5 Koyukuk 22    0.0559 0.0524  0.0458 0.00356    0.135  0       1.12 111. 
#> 6 Koyukuk 23    0.543  0.550   0.111  0.384      0.718  0       1.03  75  
#> 7 Koyukuk 31    0.282  0.281   0.102  0.123      0.453  0       1.09  75  
#> 8 Koyukuk 32    0.0162 0.00201 0.0339 0.0000491  0.0762 0.16    1.02  75  
#> 9 Koyukuk 33    0.0186 0.00574 0.0311 0.0000737  0.0709 0.0933  1.07  75
```

There’s a function in the package to make trace plots and inspect mixing
of MCMC chains.

``` r
magmatize_tr_plot(magma_summ$age_prop[[1]])
```

![trace plot render](reference/figures/README-example_trace_plot-1.png)

To see more examples on using *magma.gsi*, you can call the manual using
[`vignette("magma-vignette", package = "magma.gsi")`](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/articles/magma-vignette.md)
after you installed *magma.gsi*.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`magmatize_data()`](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/reference/magmatize_data.md)
  : Preparing MAGMA input data
- [`magmatize_indiv()`](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/reference/magmatize_indiv.md)
  : Individual group membership assignment summary
- [`magmatize_mdl()`](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/reference/magmatize_mdl.md)
  : Run MAGMA model
- [`magmatize_summ()`](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/reference/magmatize_summ.md)
  : Summarize model output
- [`magmatize_tr_plot()`](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/reference/magmatize_tr_plot.md)
  : Plot MCMC trace
- [`prep_malia_data()`](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/reference/prep_malia_data.md)
  : Prepare malia data

- [Age priors configurations
  comparison](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/articles/age_prior_comparison.md):

  descriptions](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/articles/magma-vignette.md):
- [Comparing MAGMA model
  algorithms](https://boppingshoe.github.io/magma.gsi/articles/mdl_comparison.md):
